title: Giant Condyloma Acuminata in Indonesian Females with SLE under Immunosuppressant and Steroid Therapy
patient: The patient, a 42-year-old female, was diagnosed with SLE in 2013 based on the presence of antinuclear antibodies, in addition to discoid rash and arthritis. She is sexually active with one partner, had one child, and had a history of multiple sexual partners. Since then she has been treated with methylprednisolone (32 mg/day) and mycophenolate mofetil (1000 mg/day). After six months of therapy, genital warts first appear in the vulva and anal region () and recurred in two months spreading to the pubic mound, perineum, and anal region (). It became progressively hypertrophic, resembling cauliflower. Biopsies were performed showing papillomatosis and hyperkeratosis. Type 6 and 11 HPV were identified in the lesions through RT-PCR. She was treated with excision (). The following month, she came with HPV infection in cervical region and was treated with surgical procedure (Figures and ).
